name: ORBTOWN
description:
Two players face off head-to-head in a bouncy, chaotic duel over orbs and identity!

ORBTOWN was commissioned for Death by Audio Arcade's custom-build arcade cabinet, DreamboxXx, which is permanently housed at The Dreamhouse, a queer community space, in Queens, NYC.  It also features the work of 7 other NYC based queer game devs.

Read more at:

  • Gothamist: "Step Inside The Dreamhouse, Where DIY Arcade Games Meet Queer Culture"
  • Tired of Mario World? Enter the Queer Matrixxx With Some LGBTQ Video Game Designers

100% of all proceeds from ORBTOWN go to supporting Sylvia Rivera Law Project & Make the Road NY.

Photos courtesy of Walter Wlodarczyk

Original concept and development by Juno Morrow.  Sound design, original music and concept development by Visager. 

Game and original assets (except audio) are licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0.  (source) 

Audio is ⓒ Visager 2018.
